20110119190042.000|20110119190054.000|CC1|AMERICA.

20110119190100.000|20110119190105.000|CC1|HUMANITARIAN REASONS.           
20110119190105.000|20110119190106.000|CC1|THE UNITED STATES HAS AN

20110119191253.000|20110119191302.000|CC1|YOU GET ONE.

20110119191305.000|20110119191308.000|CC1|YOUR OWN GOAL OF DOUBLING

20110119191322.000|20110119191323.000|CC1|IN THIS COUNTRY AND LOWER THE   
20110119191323.000|20110119191324.000|CC1|UNEMPLOYMENT RATE?              
20110119191324.000|20110119191326.000|CC1|>> WELL, I THINK THAT IT IS     
20110119191326.000|20110119191331.000|CC1|IMPORTANT FOR US TO LOOK AT THE 
20110119191331.000|20110119191331.000|CC1|ENTIRE ECONOMIC RELATIONSHIP AND
20110119191331.000|20110119191335.000|CC1|THE CURRENCY ISSUE IS ONE PART  
20110119191335.000|20110119191335.000|CC1|OF IT.                          
20110119191335.000|20110119191338.000|CC1|THE FIRST TIME I MET PRESIDENT  
20110119191338.000|20110119191342.000|CC1|HU WAS IN APRIL OF 2009.        
20110119191342.000|20110119191345.000|CC1|AND THIS WAS THE FIRST G-20     
20110119191345.000|20110119191347.000|CC1|SUMMIT THAT I ATTENDED WHEN WE  
20110119191347.000|20110119191352.000|CC1|WERE IN THE MIDST OF THE WORST  
20110119191352.000|20110119191353.000|CC1|FINANCIAL CRISIS THAT WE HAD    
20110119191353.000|20110119191438.000|CC1|EXPERIENCED SINCE THE 1930s.    
20110119191438.000|20110119191439.000|CC1|AND EVEN AS WE WERE TRYING TO   
20110119191439.000|20110119191442.000|CC1|STABILIZE THE FINANCIAL SYSTEM, 
20110119191442.000|20110119191443.000|CC1|WHAT WAS ABSOLUTELY CLEAR WAS   
20110119191443.000|20110119191445.000|CC1|THAT WE COULDN'T GO BACK TO A   
20110119191445.000|20110119191448.000|CC1|SYSTEM IN WHICH THE UNITED      
20110119191448.000|20110119191451.000|CC1|STATES WAS BORROWING MASSIVELY, 
20110119191451.000|20110119191453.000|CC1|CONSUMING MASSIVELY, BUT NOT    
20110119191453.000|20110119191455.000|CC1|PRODUCING AND SELLING TO THE    
20110119191455.000|20110119191457.000|CC1|REST OF THE WORLD, CREATING     
20110119191457.000|20110119191459.000|CC1|THESE HUGE BALANCES THAT HELPED 
20110119191459.000|20110119191526.000|CC1|CONTRIBUTE TO THE CRISIS.       
20110119191526.000|20110119191530.000|CC1|AND THAT'S WHY WE PUSHED AND WHY
20110119191530.000|20110119191533.000|CC1|THE G-20 ADOPTED A FRAMEWORK    
20110119191533.000|20110119191537.000|CC1|THAT CALLED FOR REBALANCING THE 
20110119191537.000|20110119191548.000|CC1|WORLD ECONOMY,                  
20110119191548.000|20110119191550.000|CC1|NOW, THAT GIVES US SOME         
20110119191550.000|20110119191550.000|CC1|RESPONSIBILITIES.               
20110119191550.000|20110119191551.000|CC1|WE'VE GOT TO SAVE MORE IN THIS  
20110119191551.000|20110119191556.000|CC1|COUNTRY.                        
20110119191556.000|20110119191559.000|CC1|WE'VE GOT TO CUT BACK ON THESE  
20110119191559.000|20110119191601.000|CC1|HUGE LEVELS OF DEBT BOTH IN THE 
20110119191601.000|20110119191601.000|CC1|PRIVATE SECTOR, BUT ALSO IN THE 
20110119191601.000|20110119191611.000|CC1|PUBLIC SECTOR.                  
20110119191611.000|20110119191615.000|CC1|IT ALSO MEANS THAT THERE'S      
20110119191615.000|20110119191616.000|CC1|STRUCTURAL REFORMS THAT WE HAVE 
20110119191616.000|20110119191618.000|CC1|TO UNDERGO TO MAKE OURSELVES    
20110119191618.000|20110119191619.000|CC1|MORE COMPETITIVE IN THE WORLD   
20110119191619.000|20110119191621.000|CC1|ECONOMY, SO MAKING SURE THAT WE 
20110119191621.000|20110119191622.000|CC1|HAVE THE BEST EDUCATION SYSTEM  
20110119191622.000|20110119191624.000|CC1|IN THE WORLD, THAT WE'RE        
20110119191624.000|20110119191625.000|CC1|PRODUCING MORE ENGINEERS THAN   
20110119191625.000|20110119191629.000|CC1|LAWYERS, MAKING SURE THAT WE    
20110119191629.000|20110119191634.000|CC1|HAVE A HANDLE ON OUR FISCAL     
20110119191634.000|20110119191635.000|CC1|PROBLEMS, MAKING SURE THAT WE'VE
20110119191635.000|20110119191637.000|CC1|GOT A WORLD CLASS               
20110119191637.000|20110119191637.000|CC1|INFRASTRUCTURE.                 
20110119191637.000|20110119191640.000|CC1|THOSE ARE ALL IMPORTANT PARTS OF
20110119191640.000|20110119191640.000|CC1|US BEING COMPETITIVE AND BEING  
20110119191640.000|20110119191719.000|CC1|ABLE TO EXPORT.                 
20110119191719.000|20110119191722.000|CC1|IT DOES ALSO MEAN, THOUGH, THAT 
20110119191722.000|20110119191723.000|CC1|WE HAVE A LEVEL PLAYING FIELD   
20110119191723.000|20110119191725.000|CC1|WHEN IT COMES TO OUR TRADING    
20110119191725.000|20110119191737.000|CC1|PARTNERS.                       
20110119191737.000|20110119191740.000|CC1|AND SO WITH RESPECT TO CHINA,   
20110119191740.000|20110119191742.000|CC1|WHAT PRESIDENT HU AND MYSELF AND
20110119191742.000|20110119191744.000|CC1|OUR DELEGATIONS HAVE DISCUSSED  
20110119191744.000|20110119191747.000|CC1|IS, HOW DO WE MAKE SURE THAT, IN
20110119191747.000|20110119191748.000|CC1|FACT, OUR TRADING RELATIONSHIP  
20110119191748.000|20110119191751.000|CC1|IS FAIR AND A WIN-WIN SITUATION 
20110119191751.000|20110119191752.000|CC1|AS OPPOSED TO A WIN-LOSE        
20110119191752.000|20110119191810.000|CC1|SITUATION.                      
20110119191810.000|20110119191813.000|CC1|SOME OF THAT HAS TO DO WITH     
20110119191813.000|20110119191814.000|CC1|ISSUES COMPLETELY UNRELATED TO  
20110119191814.000|20110119191815.000|CC1|CURRENCY.                       
20110119191815.000|20110119191816.000|CC1|FOR EXAMPLE, WE'RE MAKING       
20110119191816.000|20110119191819.000|CC1|PROGRESS ON MAKING SURE THAT THE
20110119191819.000|20110119191820.000|CC1|GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENT PROCESS  
20110119191820.000|20110119191823.000|CC1|IN CHINA IS OPEN AND FAIR TO    
20110119191823.000|20110119191825.000|CC1|AMERICAN BUSINESSES.            
20110119191825.000|20110119191825.000|CC1|AND WE'VE MADE PROGRESS AS A    
20110119191825.000|20110119191845.000|CC1|CONSEQUENCE OF THIS STATE VISIT.
20110119191845.000|20110119191848.000|CC1|SOME OF IT HAS TO DO WITH       
20110119191848.000|20110119191849.000|CC1|INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY           
20110119191849.000|20110119191850.000|CC1|PROTECTION.                     
20110119191850.000|20110119191851.000|CC1|SO WE WERE JUST IN A MEETING    
20110119191851.000|20110119191854.000|CC1|WITH BUSINESS LEADERS AND STEVE 
20110119191854.000|20110119191856.000|CC1|BALLMER OF MICROSOFT POINTED OUT
20110119191856.000|20110119191858.000|CC1|THAT THEIR ESTIMATE IS THAT ONLY
20110119191858.000|20110119191859.000|CC1|ONE CUSTOMER IN EVERY TEN OF    
20110119191859.000|20110119191901.000|CC1|THEIR PRODUCTS IS ACTUALLY      
20110119191901.000|20110119191902.000|CC1|PAYING FOR IT IN CHINA.         
20110119191902.000|20110119191905.000|CC1|AND SO, CAN WE GET BETTER       
20110119191905.000|20110119191907.000|CC1|ENFORCEMENT SINCE THAT IS AN    
20110119191907.000|20110119191910.000|CC1|AREA WHERE AMERICA EXCELS

20110119191946.000|20110119191948.000|CC1|AND THE CHINESE GOVERNMENT HAS, 
20110119191948.000|20110119191950.000|CC1|TO ITS CREDIT, TAKEN STEPS TO   
20110119191950.000|20110119191952.000|CC1|BETTER ENFORCE INTELLECTUAL

20110119191953.000|20110119191954.000|CC1|WE'VE GOT FURTHER AGREEMENT AS A
20110119191954.000|20110119191956.000|CC1|CONSEQUENCE OF THIS STATE VISIT,
20110119191956.000|20110119191958.000|CC1|AND I THINK PRESIDENT HU WOULD  
20110119191958.000|20110119191959.000|CC1|ACKNOWLEDGE THAT MORE NEEDS TO  
20110119191959.000|20110119192016.000|CC1|BE DONE.

20110119192020.000|20110119192025.000|CC1|OF THE PROBLEM, THE RMB IS      
20110119192025.000|20110119192026.000|CC1|UNDERVALUED.

20110119192028.000|20110119192030.000|CC1|INTERVENED VERY FORCELY IN THE

20110119192031.000|20110119192035.000|CC1|THEY'VE SPENT $200 BILLION JUST 
20110119192035.000|20110119192037.000|CC1|RECENTLY, AND THAT'S AN         
20110119192037.000|20110119192039.000|CC1|INDICATION OF THE DEGREE TO     
20110119192039.000|20110119192041.000|CC1|WHICH IT'S STILL UNDERVALUED.

20110119193154.000|20110119193155.000|CC1|>> Translator: AS THE JOURNALIST
20110119193155.000|20110119193157.000|CC1|WHO RAISED THAT QUESTION SAID

20110119193203.000|20110119193207.000|CC1|AND I WOULD LIKE TO STRESS HERE

20110119193224.000|20110119193226.000|CC1|FIGHTING TERRORISM, UPHOLDING

20110119193246.000|20110119193248.000|CC1|TO MEET THE CHALLENGE.          
20110119193248.000|20110119193252.000|CC1|CHINA IS THE BIGGEST DEVELOPING 
20110119193252.000|20110119193252.000|CC1|COUNTRY AND THE UNITED STATES   
20110119193252.000|20110119193254.000|CC1|BIGGEST DEVELOPED COUNTRY.      
20110119193254.000|20110119193257.000|CC1|IN THIS CONTEMPT, IT IS         
20110119193257.000|20110119193258.000|CC1|NECESSARY FOR CHINA AND THE

20110119193259.000|20110119193303.000|CC1|THEIR COOPERATION TO MEET SUCH  
20110119193303.000|20110119193304.000|CC1|CHALLENGES.                     
20110119193304.000|20110119193306.000|CC1|THEN HOW CAN CHINA AND THE U.S. 
20110119193306.000|20110119193309.000|CC1|DO A BETTER JOB IN WORKING      
20110119193309.000|20110119193310.000|CC1|TOGETHER TO MEET GLOBAL         
20110119193310.000|20110119193311.000|CC1|CHALLENGES?                     
20110119193311.000|20110119193312.000|CC1|I THINK THERE ARE THREE POINTS I
20110119193312.000|20110119193314.000|CC1|WOULD LIKE TO MAKE.             
20110119193314.000|20110119193317.000|CC1|AND THESE THREE POINTS DESERVE  
20110119193317.000|20110119193319.000|CC1|OUR SERIOUS ATTENTION AND       
20110119193319.000|20110119193320.000|CC1|CONSIDERATION.                  
20110119193320.000|20110119193323.000|CC1|NUMBER ONE, THAT OUR TWO SIDES  
20110119193323.000|20110119193326.000|CC1|HAVE ACTED IN THE SPIRIT OF     
20110119193326.000|20110119193329.000|CC1|COOPERATION AS IF WE WERE IN THE
20110119193329.000|20110119193331.000|CC1|SAME BOAT THAT WE SHOULD ROW IN 
20110119193331.000|20110119193332.000|CC1|THE SAME DIRECTION.             
20110119193332.000|20110119193335.000|CC1|WHEN WE TACKLED PREVIOUS        
20110119193335.000|20110119193336.000|CC1|INTERNATIONAL CHALLENGES, AND I 
20110119193336.000|20110119193340.000|CC1|THINK WE NEED TO KEEP UP THE    
20110119193340.000|20110119193342.000|CC1|SPIRIT IN FUTURE AS WE TACKLE   
20110119193342.000|20110119193342.000|CC1|CHALLENGES.                     
20110119193342.000|20110119193345.000|CC1|NUMBER TWO, WE NEED TO INCREASE

20110119194805.000|20110119194807.000|CC1|THE BACKPACK THAT ALSO HELD THE 
20110119194807.000|20110119194808.000|CC1|BOMB.                           
20110119194808.000|20110119194810.000|CC1|AND THEY'RE HOPING THAT IF      
20110119194810.000|20110119194812.000|CC1|PEOPLE SEE THESE THINGS, THEY   
20110119194812.000|20110119194813.000|CC1|MIGHT THINK THEY KNOW SOMEONE   
20110119194813.000|20110119194815.000|CC1|WHO HAD THE BRAND BACKPACK OR   
20110119194815.000|20110119194817.000|CC1|THOSE T-SHIRTS SO THEY HOPE THAT
